inference: The circumference of the entire circle is $2\pi(18)=36\pi$.  The circumference of the sector is $\frac{300}{360}(36\pi)=30\pi$. This is the circumference of the base of the cone.  The radius of the base of the cone is then $\frac{30\pi}{2\pi}=15$.  The slant height of the cone is 18.  By the Pythagorean Theorem, the height of the cone is $\sqrt{18^2-15^2}=\sqrt{144}=12$.  The volume of the cone is $\frac{1}{3}\pi(15^2)(12)=900\pi$, so the answer is $\boxed{900}$.  I hope it is correct.

question:
The circumference of the entire circle is $2\pi(18)=36\pi$.  The circumference of the sector is $\frac{300}{360}(36\pi)=30\pi$. This is the circumference of the base of the cone.  The radius of the base of the cone is then $\frac{30\pi}{2\pi}=15$.  The slant height of the cone is 18.  By the Pythagorean Theorem, the height of the cone is $\sqrt{18^2-15^2}=\sqrt{144}=12$.  The volume of the cone is $\frac{1}{3}\pi(15^2)(12)=900\pi$, so the answer is $\boxed{900}$.  I hope it is correct.
